lines.text: [During the opening credits, Dr. Sam Loomis can be heard saying a line from the original "Halloween"]

I met him fifteen years ago. I was told there was nothing left. No reason, no conscience, no understanding, even the most rudimentary sense of life or death, good or evil, right or wrong. I met this six-year-old child, with this blank, pale, emotionless face and the blackest eyes... the devil's eyes. I spent eight years trying to reach him, and then another seven trying to keep him locked up because I realized that what was living behind that boy's eyes was purely and simply... evil.
Hasn't anyone ever told you that second-hand smoke kills?
Yeah, but they're all dead.
My brother killed my sister.
How did he do that?
With a really big, sharp kitchen knife.
It just occured to me today that I've never celebrated Halloween before.
And why's that?
Oh, we've got a psychotic serial killer in the family who loves to butcher people on Halloween, and I just thought it in bad taste to celebrate.
How about you? Are you tired of my bullshit?
I'm a counselor; I'm attracted to it.
What should I do?
Try to live.
Oh. Miss Tate. I didn't mean to make you jump. It's Halloween. I guess everyone's entitled to one good scare.
I've had my share.
[Laurie, Will and the kids have just survived from Michael]
Who was that?
My brother.

[it's just her and Michael left at the school]
MICHAEEEEL!
I'm not who you think I am.
Okay. Who are you?
My name's not Kerri Tate.
Oooh. What is it?
Laurie Strode.
Strode?
Strode. I changed my name when I went into hiding.
Oh, I like that. That's like... like... like the Witness Protection Program. What did you, like, rat out the mob, or something?
My brother killed my sister... when she was 17.
Well, that's... suck-y. How'd he do that?
With a really big, sharp kitchen knife.
That's terrible. Take off your clothes.
You said you'd listen.
Okay.
They locked him up for a long time, but he got out and... he came after me. But I got away. But he killed a lot of my friends. It happened -...
You've heard the story.
Who hasn't? Michael Myers. It's like 20 years ago, right?
And the girl that... What happened to the sister? She died, right?
No. She faked her death... and, now, she's the head mistress of a very posh, secluded private school in Northern California.
What?
Hoping and praying every year... that her brother won't find her.
You're telling me the truth?
Now, do you want a drink?
Mom, I am not responsible for you. That's it, I've had enough. I can't take it anymore mom. He's dead. Michael Myers is dead.
Because today is the day. I can feel it. Today is the day you are going to realize that I am seventeen years old and your overprotection and paranoia is inhibiting my growing process.
If you want to stay handcuffed to your dead brother, that's fine. But you're not dragging me along. Not anymore.
Okay, John. I know that you get your smart mouth from my side of the family, so I'll cut you a break.
[about shoplifting a bottle of alcoholic drink]
I can't believe we're doing this.
Desperate measures.
It's illegal.
It's harmless and expected.
Party of One. Okay Charlie, no sex games till I've eaten.
Ah, Fuck Me Shit.
[Fitz decides to contact Haddonfield about Michael Myers]
All right, you tell 'em to look for a guy with a cane and Alzheimer's.
The guy would be younger than I am, okay? I was 15 when he killed his sister back in '63.
[Holding a Hockey Stick]
Jimmy's been suspended five times this year already for gettin' a little crazy with the STICK.
[to John Tate]
You're an Oedipal enabler.

[His mother won't let him go away on an overnight school camping trip]
Dad would let me go.
Well, *Dad* is an abusive, chain smoking, methadone addict.
Who would attract someone like that?
Ouch.
And to think *he* left *you*!
John! I know you get your smart mouth from my side of the family. But point check, you're going too far!
Michael Myers... yeah, right!
Okay Charlie, no sex kinks till I've eaten.
My name's not Keri Tate.
Oooh, what is it?
Laurie Strode.

[laughs]
Strode?
